net.nand.util.i18n.gui

Class PropertiesTranslatorEditor.RequestFocusListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.nand.util.i18n.gui.PropertiesTranslatorEditor.RequestFocusListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.AncestorListener
    Enclosing class:
    PropertiesTranslatorEditor

    public static class PropertiesTranslatorEditor.RequestFocusListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.AncestorListener
    Utility to give a component field the input focus when used in JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog.
    Usage:
    textfield.addAncestorListener(new RequestFocusListener());

    Needed because by default the OK button has focus, but user wants to type something. Overriding addNotify() to requestFocus() doesn't work: Swing setup is asynchronous and the button requests focus afterwards per Bug JDK-5018574: Unable to set focus to another component in JOptionPane (as seen 2016-11-25). Tested on OSX Java 1.5 to work with JTextField and JTextArea.

    Adapted from Jim Morris' 2011-07-14 answer (licensed CC BY-SA 3.0) to http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6251665/setting-component-focus-in-joptionpane-showoptiondialog :

    • Class javadoc for background and context
    • Put JTextComponent cursor at end, not start, of JTextArea
    • Prevent JTextField default select-all
    • SwingUtilities.invokeLater -> EventQueue.invokeLater
    • Declare final al = this -> use RequestFocusListener.this
